articles.description: Lewis Hamilton and George Russell will continue as Mercedes' driver line-up for at least the next two years.
articles.title: Hamilton and Russell extend Mercedes contracts

articles.description: Reaction as Rangers are knocked out of the Champions League and Sheffield United bow out of the EFL Cup - plus transfer news.
articles.title: Champions League & EFL Cup reaction, plus transfers latest

articles.description: Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku agrees to join Italian side Roma on a season-long loan deal from Chelsea.
articles.title: Lukaku joins Roma on loan from Chelsea

articles.description: Canada's Danielle McGahey is set to become the first transgender cricketer to play in an official T20 international.
articles.title: First transgender cricketer to play T20 international

articles.description: A crowd of 92,003 fans watch Nebraska beat Omaha at their Memorial Stadium to set a new record attendance for a women's sporting event.
articles.title: US volleyball match sets women's attendance record

articles.description: Michael Beale said the Champions League qualifiers "came too soon" for Rangers, but time is not on his side with Celtic looming.
articles.title: Rangers not ready for PSV, but should they have been?

articles.description: England captain Jos Buttler makes "one of the all-time terrible reviews" after appealing for an lbw decison against New Zealand in the first T20 at Chester-le-Street.
articles.title: 'One of the all-time terrible reviews' Buttler wastes England review

articles.description: The mother of Spanish football federation president Luis Rubiales is discharged from hospital having been admitted after going on hunger strike.
articles.title: Rubiales' mother leaves hospital after hunger strike

articles.description: Former world number one Caroline Wozniacki claims the biggest win of her comeback by beating 11th seed Petra Kvitova to reach the US Open third round.
articles.title: Notable US Open win is dream come true - Wozniacki

articles.description: Spain and Barcelona forward Ansu Fati is heading to Brighton to complete a season-long loan move to the Premier League side.
articles.title: Brighton set to sign Fati on loan from Barcelona
